--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 644809634.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0174/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0174/input.gen.gz -int 44059478 44059478 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0174/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr1.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0174/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0174/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr1.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0174/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0174/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0174/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0174/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0174/output_warnings

MCMC iteration [30/30]


diploid sampling success rate: 0.984

haploid sampling success rate: (no haploid sampling performed)


--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 235429356.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0191/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0191/input.gen.gz -int 75419740 75419740 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0191/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0191/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0191/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0191/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0191/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0191/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0191/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0191/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 233 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand]
 --read strand info for 1370 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0191/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 12 individuals
 --read 1010 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 0 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0191/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 31 individuals
 --read 570 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 175 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1010 SNPs in Panel 2

The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 849173286.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0201/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0201/input.gen.gz -int 147553909 147553909 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0201/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr5.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0201/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0201/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr5.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0201/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0201/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0201/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0201/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0201/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 797 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr5.strand]
 --read strand info for 1945 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0201/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 12 individuals
 --read 2143 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 14 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0201/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 134 individuals
 --read 1911 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 614 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2143 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1297 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------

--------------

[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-In total, 2144 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 1296 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1244768257.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0228/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0228/input.gen.gz -int 149816992 149816992 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0228/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr1.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0228/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0228/input.gen.gz

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1227635803.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0241/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0241/input.gen.gz -int 241626867 241626867 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0241/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr2.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0241/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0241/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr2.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0241/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0241/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0241/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0241/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0241/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 392 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr2.strand]
 --read strand info for 1878 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0241/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 12 individuals
 --read 2353 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 6 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0241/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 130 individuals
 --read 2451 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 745 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2353 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1706 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-Upstream buffer region

 --1161 total SNPs

 --0 type 3 SNPs

-Output file
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 2354 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 1705 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters

        reference diplotypes: 130 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 12 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [241626867,241626867]
                      buffer: 250 kb
                          Ne: 20000

diploid sampling success rate: 0.991

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 789384785.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0278/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0278/input.gen.gz -int 180526696 180526696 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0278/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr5.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0278/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0278/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr5.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0278/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0278/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0278/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0278/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0278/output_warnings

-----------------

 Imputation accuracy assessment

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 782444055.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0286/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0286/input.gen.gz -int 54338897 54338897 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0286/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr7.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0286/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0286/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr7.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0286/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0286/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0286/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0286/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0286/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 652 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr7.strand]
 --read strand info for 2261 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0286/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 12 individuals
 --read 2409 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 9 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0286/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 131 individuals
 --read 3300 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1284 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2409 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 2016 SNPs with data in multiple panels

[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 292049286.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0325/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0325/input.gen.gz -int 37392204 37392204 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0325/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0325/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0325/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0325/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0325/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0325/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0325/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0325/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 422 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand]
 --read strand info for 1728 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0325/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 12 individuals
 --read 1574 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 3 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0325/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 134 individuals
 --read 1890 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 718 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1574 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1172 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 314656984.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0344/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0344/input.gen.gz -int 35020763 35020763 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0344/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr14_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr14.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0344/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0344/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr14.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr14_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0344/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0344/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0344/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0344/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0344/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 278979081.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370nd/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370nd/input.gen.gz -int 20523200 20523200 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370nd/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr16.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370nd/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370nd/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr16.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370nd/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370nd/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370nd/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370nd/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370nd/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 503 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr16.strand]
 --read strand info for 2086 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370nd/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 12 individuals
 --read 1851 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 12 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0370nd/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 31 individuals
 --read 1461 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 502 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1851 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 959 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-Upstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --471 type 2 SNPs
 --586 type 3 SNPs
 --1057 total SNPs

-Downstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --487 type 2 SNPs
 --307 type 3 SNPs
 --794 total SNPs

-Analysis region (as defined by -int argument)
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs
 --1 total SNPs

-Output file
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 1852 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 958 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters 
----------------

        reference diplotypes: 31 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 12 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [20523200,20523200]
                      buffer: 250 kb
                          Ne: 20000
           input call thresh: 0.900
     burn-in MCMC iterations: 10
       total MCMC iterations: 30 (20 used for inference)
      HMM states for phasing: 60 [Panel 1]; 80 [Panel 2]
   HMM states for imputation: 62 [Panel 1->2]

---------

---------

MCMC iteration [1/30]

MCMC iteration [2/30]

MCMC iteration [3/30]

RESETTING PARAMETERS FOR "SURROGATE FAMILY" MODELING
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

MCMC iteration [30/30]


diploid sampling success rate: 0.981

haploid sampling success rate: (no haploid sampling performed)


--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1725153495.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0371/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0371/input.gen.gz -int 58154902 58154902 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0371/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr17_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr17.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0371/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0371/input.gen.gz

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1994371167.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0374/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0374/input.gen.gz -int 28950753 28950753 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0374/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr17_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr17.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0374/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0374/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr17.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr17_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0374/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0374/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0374/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0374/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0374/output_warnings

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1862404861.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/input.gen.gz -int 25909500 25909500 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr20_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr20.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr20.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr20_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr20_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 195 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr20.strand]
 --read strand info for 103 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 12 individuals
 --read 57 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 0 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0382/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 30 individuals
 --read 968 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 950 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 57 SNPs in Panel 2

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 18 SNPs with data in multiple panels

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1408907714.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/input.gen.gz -int 48921073 48921073 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr7.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr7.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 564 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr7.strand]
 --read strand info for 2369 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 12 individuals
 --read 2088 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 4 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0486/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 129 individuals
 --read 2437 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 985 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2088 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1452 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!
